elements.name: question4
elements.title: What is ransomware?
elements.correctAnswer: Malware in which data on the attacked computer is encrypted and can no longer be edited. The company is then blackmailed into not getting the data back until a ransom has been paid.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: How does a ransomware attack work?
elements.correctAnswer: Ransomware is installed via email attachments. These then encrypt the work data. This is followed by a demand for a ransom.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What is your company doing to protect itself against ransomware?

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Why is the transfer made with Bitcoin? Here you need to think about something.
elements.correctAnswer: Btc or other cryptocurrencies are not so easy to track, bank transfers could at best be reversed, but this is not so easy with Bitcoin transfers.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: What is being done in your company to prevent ransomware attacks? What can you do as an employee?

elements.name: question9
elements.title: What data is absolutely essential in your company in order to be able to continue working in the event of a ransomware attack?
